kpis.description: The point at which total revenue equals total costs, meaning the business is not making a profit or a loss.
The sales volume at which the firm covers all the costs, indicating the minimum sales needed to avoid losses.
kpis.formula: Sales Volume = Total Fixed Costs / (Selling Price per Unit - Variable Cost per Unit)

kpis.description: Net profit to total revenue percent, showing the percentage of revenue that remains as profit after all expenses are deducted.
kpis.formula: Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) * 100

kpis.description: Total fixed cost to total cost ratio, indicating the proportion of fixed costs in relation to total costs.
kpis.formula: Total Fixed Cost Ratio = Total Fixed Costs / Total Costs

kpis.description: Contribution margin per unit to selling price ratio, representing the portion of sales revenue that exceeds total variable costs.
kpis.formula: Contribution Margin Ratio = (Contribution Margin per Unit / Selling Price per Unit) * 100
